messages.message:
Does anyone know whats going on here? I'm trying to run a local flow using `app-tasks` running with `python2` and its giving me a pickle error:
```
[2019-10-22 11:44:13,975: CRITICAL/MainProcess] Unrecoverable error: DecodeError(ValueError('unsupported pickle protocol: 3',),)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/aarontami/venv_python2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/celery/worker/worker.py", line 205, in start
    self.blueprint.start(self)
  File "/Users/aarontami/venv_python2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/celery/bootsteps.py", line 119, in start
  ...
```
Seems like the error is coming from within celery libraries.  From some googling, seems that python 2 only supports pickle protocols 0, 1, 2.
@Aaron Tami I think if you want to run one thing in python2, everything needs to be run in python2
i see, all the other services also need to be python2?
i think so. should get confirmation from someone else, though
Yep all *celery* services need to be run in the same python version
Yes all services api-server-apps and app-tasks need to all be run in either Python 2 or Python 3, all or nothing
